titles.title: TANF Extension Programs bill
TANF and Related Programs Continuation Act of 2004
TANF and Related Programs Continuation Act of 2004
TANF and Related Programs Continuation Act of 2004
TANF and Related Programs Continuation Act of 2004
To reauthorize the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families block grant program through September 30, 2004, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Human Resources.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Mr. Herger moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4589.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 6/30/2004--Public Law. TANF and Related Programs Continuation Act of 2004 - Amends title IV of the Social Security Act (SSA) to extend through September 30, 2004: (1) the TANF block grant program under part A (Temporary Assistance for Needy Families) (TANF), including the sexual activity abstinence education program and eligibility for Medicaid under SSA title XIX; (2) the National Random Sample Study of Child Welfare under part B (Child and Family Services); and (3) demonstration projects likely to promote the objectives of part B (Child and Family Services) or part E (Foster Care and Adoption Assistance). Makes appropriations for such purposes. Authorizes grants and payments pursuant to such authority through the fourth quarter of FY 2004 at the level provided for such activities through the fourth quarter of FY 2002.
